Title: An Evaluation of the Employee Self-Service Feature of SAP System with Technology Acceptance Model (TAM): A Case Study
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Veronica, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The aim of this study is to assess the adoption of enterprise resource planning (ERP) in PT.ABC, a banking company in Indonesia which is using SAP NetWeaver and a module focused on employee self-service (ESS). In this study, the method of the Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) was used to test the relationship between the variables (Perceived Usefulness, Perceived Ease of Use, Attitude towards Usage and Behavioral Intention to Use). This study data was obtained through interviews, literature reviews and questionnaires from a total of 129 respondents who were users of ESS systems using regression sampling and the data was analyzed using SmartPLS. The analysis shows positive and significant results from the four hypotheses. The results of the study show that the perception of use required further development to improve the system and process, which in this study contains recommendations for further development. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: ESS; Human capital management; Smart PLS; TAM
Index Keywords: Acceptance tests; Enterprise resource planning; Information management; Personnel; Behavioral intention; Enterprise resource planning (ERP); Indonesia; Literature reviews; Perceived ease of use; Perceived usefulness; SAP systems; Technology acceptance model; Surveys

Title: User Satisfaction Survey of Performance Management Dashboard Using Delone McLean Method: A Case Study
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Veronica, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suryawan, A.D., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Performance management information systems are one way to evaluate the performance of a work unit. Therefore, it is imperative to use information systems, so that monitoring and evaluation activities can run smoothly and in real time. Binus University has done implementations for the last five years by using a Performance Management dashboard, so that user satisfaction needs can be measured, especially users in the academic area by applying the DeLone and McLean method. This research utilized an instrument from DeLone and McLean as well as measured the questionnaire results of all the academic users of Binus University. The final results are expected to be able to improve the services and features needed by the academic users of Binus University. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: dashboard; DeLone and McLean method; management; performance; satisfaction
Index Keywords: Information use; Management; Real time systems; Surveys; dashboard; DeLone and McLean method; Monitoring and evaluations; performance; Performance management; Real time; satisfaction; User satisfaction; Information management

Title: Information Technology Service Performance Management Using COBIT and ITIL Frameworks : A Case Study
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Suryawan, A.D., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Veronica, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In managing, regenerating, and fixing the operational performance of university required an information systems. IT division responsible to provide the proper information systems based on business and user perspective with decent quality IT service. Therefore, it is pertinent to measure the IT service performance must matching with the user needs and make users satisfied for using information systems. This research purpose is to identify and analyze the service maturity level that provided by IT division of BINUS University to information systems users, so that an evaluation of IT service performance is obtained. This research methodology is a questionnaire, literature study, and a data analysis of BINUS University, designing and measuring the maturity level by using the COBIT framework and the ITIL framework, as well as testing the relationship between the COBIT and ITIL maturity level results. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: COBIT; IT service; ITIL; maturity level; performance management
Index Keywords: Information management; Information systems; COBIT; IT services; ITIL; Maturity levels; Performance management; Information use

Title: Information technology service performance management using COBIT and an ITIL framework: A systematic literature review
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Veronica, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Debora Suryawan, A., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Information systems play a significant role in assisting and improving a university's operational work performance. The quality of IT service is also needed to provide an information system that matches with a university's needs. As a result, evaluations need to be conducted towards IT services in fulfilling the needs and providing satisfaction for information systems users. The purpose of this paper was to conduct a synthesis of the service work performance provided by the IT Division towards information systems users by using systematic literature review. The methodology used in this research was a literature study related with a COBIT and ITIL framework, as well as finding the interrelatedness between service managements toward an increase of IT work performance. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: COBIT; IT service; ITIL; performance management; SLR; systematic literature review
Index Keywords: Information systems; Information use; COBIT; IT services; ITIL; Performance management; Systematic literature review; Information management

Title: The design of web-based information system of community progress
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Veronica, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Sari, I.M., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: The goals of the research were to identify, analyze, and design a web-based information system and implement business process improvement to support and enhance the current business processes in some banks in Indonesia who run Community development program to improve the economy of Indonesia. The System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) method was applied for the system analysis and design phases, utilizing Unified Modelling Language (UML) to model the system. Analysis was based on the company's current business processes, which results were translated into the design of a web-based information system which supports the current processes of the community empowerment program, especially in report documentation and verification, progress monitoring through an up-to-date dashboard and a Community Maturity Model (CoMM) that help organization to know better about the progress of the communities. The web-based platform enables ease of access for conducting work in various places. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Analysis and Design; Community Empowerment; Information System; Monitoring; Reporting; SDLC; UML

Title: The impact of internet technology on creating new positions in Indonesia study case : Companies in Jakarta
Source title: Proceedings - 2015 International Conference on Science in Information Technology: Big Data Spectrum for Future Information Economy, ICSITech 2015
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Binus University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Lisanti, Y., School of Information Systems, Binus University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Luhukay, D., School of Information Systems, Binus University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Veronica, School of Information Systems, Binus University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Internet technology has changed many aspects in business these days, from new product and services development, to business process improvement such as online tender, mobile payment, online registration, and many others. As a result of those changes, companies need the right resources who understand on how to do business and compete in this new economy hence new competencies are hired. This research found many new positions have been created due to the changes, which do not exist in the past, or would sounds very strange 5 to 10 years ago. Positions such as social media specialist, mobile application developer or search engine optimization specialist are some of popular positions in Indonesia, especially in Jakarta. The research showed that internet has a positive impact on opening new jobs and creating new positions too in Indonesia. © 2015 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Indonesia; internet technology; new competencies; new economy; new jobs; new positions; positive impact; resources
Index Keywords: Internet; Search engines; Indonesia; Internet technology; new competencies; New economy; new jobs; New position; positive impact; resources; Big data

Authors: Lisanti Y., Luhukay D., Veronica, Mariani V.
Title: The design of knowledge management system model for SME (Small and Medium Enterprise) (Phase 2-The pilot implementation in IT SMEs)
Source title: 2014 2nd International Conference on Information and Communication Technology, ICoICT 2014
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Lisanti, Y., School of Information Systems, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Luhukay, D., School of Information Systems, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Veronica, School of Information Systems, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia; Mariani, V., School of Information Systems, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: SME (Small and Medium Enterprise) or also known as UKM (Usaha Kecil dan Menengah) in Indonesia plays an important role to develop our economy, however, as we found not too many studies have been performed to improve its information management such as the knowledge management system, which we believe would facilitate new joiners to start up and also existing SMEs to grow their business, hence since 2013 the team has started to conduct a research in this area. This article will share our experience when we implemented the KMS for SME in several IT SMEs in Jakarta. We learned that choosing the right implementation approach, such as involving SMEs association, vendors/suppliers and professional to develop the content and encourage SMEs to participate, are crucial for the success of this project. © 2014 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Implementation approac; Information Management; KMS; Pilot project; SME; UKM
Index Keywords: Human resource management; Information management; Knowledge based systems; Implementation approac; KMS; Pilot projects; SME; UKM; Knowledge management
